text: Question 19 8 -0.33 MARKS Your Time Taken: 2m Avg Time Taken By Others: Im59s Attempt Accuracy: 27% B+ Tree Consider the following statements: S-1:Given a set S of n real keys chosen at random from a uniform distribution over [a, b), a binary search tree can be constructed on S in O(n) expected time. S-2:Deleting a node from a binary search tree on n nodes takes O(lg n) time in the worst case only S-1is true only S-2 is true Both are true none
